title: CELL-BACTERIA INTERACTION USING MICROFLUIDICS AND OPTICAL TWEEZERS
abstractText: There is a dramatic need to reduce costs in biological and medical research and diagnosis, and one approach to this is developing automated methods that use computers to control routine laboratory work. This project fits within this vision, and we propose an automated method for studying the process of bacterial infection of cells. Our approach makes use of the latest developments in optics and in fabrication of patterned surfaces.
